text: Ahmadou Babatoura Ahidjo (24 August 1924 â€“ 30 November 1989) was a Cameroonian politician. He was the first President of Cameroon, holding the office from 1960 until 1982. Ahidjo played a major role Cameroon's independence from France as well as reuniting the French and English-speaking parts of the country. He was also the country's first Prime Minister from January 1960 to May 1960. Ahidjo resigned from the presidency in 1981, and Paul Biya replaced him. He was accused of being behind a coup plot against Biya in 1984. He was sentenced to death, but he died of a heart attack on 30 November 1989 at the age of 65. ==References== Category:1924 births Category:1989 deaths Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:Presidents of Cameroon Category:Prime ministers of Cameroon
title: Ahmadou Ahidjo
